title: Junior Back End Engineer
description:
**About minware**
-----------------



minware provides engineering business metrics that show the true cost of engineering impediments. This helps organizations make better decisions with stronger alignment between engineers and executives.



Kevin Borders founded minware after bootstrapping his previous company to $86m in revenue and selling in 2021, with the idea of helping others benefit from lessons learned growing an engineering team from 0 to 40.



minware is a self-funded seed-stage company. After promising initial customer traction, we are looking for people who share our values to help bring minware to a larger audience.


**The Role**
------------



As an early engineer, you will have the unique opportunity to work directly with minware's founders to build the product from the ground up. We are looking for someone who enjoys designing, developing, and maintaining back-end applications.



We are seeking an ambitious and nice engineer who has experience independently executing complex projects and building scalable, maintainable software. As a purveyor of developer productivity analytics, we are diligent about process efficiency and code quality. Though we are small, we try to avoid unnecessarily creating technical debt and are looking for someone who can lead us toward this goal.


**Primary Responsibilities**
----------------------------


* Independently design, develop, and maintain server-side applications, ensuring the optimal performance, security, and scalability of our service
* Work closely with product managers and customers to define minware's capabilities
* Design and architect new system components
* Manage a backlog of tech debt reduction and internal efficiency improvements

**Qualifications**
------------------


* Experience building and maintaining a complex back end application
* Familiarity with principles of high-quality code, including continuous integration, declarative and functional programming
* Strong communication skills for interfacing with non-technical stakeholders and occasionally with customers
* Well-versed in agile or lean planning and project management processes
* Experience with the core stack (Postgres, Next.js, Apollo GraphQL) or similar technologies is preferred
* Proficiency with infrastructure (AWS, Terraform) is optional, but nice to have

**Benefits and Perks**
----------------------


* Competitive base salary, bonus, and seed-stage equity compensation
* 100% remote work, flexible hours, and unlimited vacation policy. (Read here about how we built trust in our previous all-remote company.)
* Full health care premium coverage for you and your family
* Unique career development guidance reporting directly to the founder/CEO


We offer competitive compensation packages along with stock options based on industry benchmarks for function, and level. Offer amounts are determined by multiple factors such as a candidate's experience and expertise.

**Base Compensation:**


$85,000—$120,000 USD

title: Back End Developer
description:
TeamUp, a DaySmart company, has consistently had one mission since launching in 2012: to provide the best management software for fitness studios, boxes, and gyms. We provide boutique gyms, studios, boxes, and independent fitness businesses with professional management software. We work with thousands of like-minded owners who help millions of customers achieve their goals.  

  

As an engineer at TeamUp, you'll have the opportunity to positively impact users with your expertise in the backend systems that drive our ecosystem forward. Your work will define our user experience and ensure our services meet performance and capacity expectations. In addition to technical expertise, you'll find that your teammates value collaboration, mentorship, and inclusive environments.  

  

**Responsibilities*** Architect and build TeamUp’s scalable and reliable product as well as core backend components for complex systems, focusing on performance, scalability, flexibility, and security
* Take ownership for designing, building, and maintaining our REST APIs, data models, and business logic
* Work closely with our Product, QA, and frontend engineering teams to help shape the product roadmap and deliver well-thought-out and stable solutions to our customers' most important needs
* Ensure that the architecture matches industry-standard security policies (and vice-versa), helping to establish processes to drive operational excellence in critical areas such as systems reliability and SLA management
* Debug production issues across multiple services and levels of the stack
* Improve engineering standards, tooling, and processes

  

**Required Skills*** Prior experience with web application backends
* Have experience with Python, Django and SQL
* Open to joining a fast-paced environment
* 3+ years of working experience

  

**Nice to have*** You have experience leading a team and mentoring team members
* BS or MS in computer science, engineering, or other technical degrees
* Experience working on both backend and frontend projects
* A servant leader who leads by doing

  

When using TeamUp, managing day-to-day processes (customer billing, instructor payroll, receipts, business analytics) will be seamless, hassle-free, save time, and allow our customers to focus on elevating their business's success. Our software will help empower our customers to build the business they dreamed about when they started them.  

  

From the customer's perspective, booking a class or workout has never been easier than it is when the gym is TeamUp. Our software enables consumers to enjoy their classes and the smooth booking experience without the hassle they've been used to with other systems.  

  

DaySmart is committed to creating a diverse employee environment and is a proud equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, sexual orientation, national origin, disability, age, or veteran status.

title: Freelance Front End Developer
description:
***This is a freelance role.***

Gramercy Consultants, LLC (“Gramercy Tech”) is an award winning digital agency that was born out of the need to bring digital experiences to live events. We specialize in everything from concept creation, design, and software development to event management, credentialing and access control. Our team members are passionate about innovation, collaboration, and supporting one another. We are constantly striving to improve our platform and ourselves so that we can better support our clients.

Gramercy Tech is proud to be recognized by Clutch in their 2019 report as one of the top UX designers in New York and by Manifest as one of the top 25 IT services companies in New York. Additionally, we secured a spot on the Leader’s Matrix as a proven market leader and the top 8th UX consulting firm in New York City.

Our team is looking for a **Freelance Front End Developer** with extensive CSS and Javascript/jQuery experience that can help us manage and create content within our proprietary event CMS / platform, Eventfinity. The ideal candidate is passionate about design / UI / UX, is quick on their feet, has experience customizing content from top to bottom - especially within third party environments (think Squarespace, Weebly, Shopify, etc), and enjoys working in a fast paced environment.

This is not a traditional front end role -- the majority of work will be manipulating content in an existing structure/template, and implementing creative solutions utilizing Javascript/jQuery and CSS to accommodate client requests for customization. Experience working with a legacy codebase and existing within the confines of that environment is helpful.

The Eventfinity platform powers hybrid virtual events (e.g. agendas, video content, attendee directories, networking, chat rooms), as well as badge printing and mobile apps for in-person events. Front end developer responsibilities include working with project managers, clients, and the design team to bring events to life on the front end by editing plug-ins and client facing app code, strategizing around ways to use existing functionality to achieve client requests, or writing custom CSS and JS/jQuery to manipulate the current CMS functionalities and customize platform functionality. Candidates should have an eye for design and be well versed in JS / jQuery, CSS, and HTML.

Although the main focus of this role is almost entirely on the front-end side, there is always the possibility of growth; so knowledge of Vue, PHP, and Laravel is considered an important plus in order to facilitate communication between the front-end team and the back-end programmers who manage the development of the Eventfinity platform.

**Qualifications:**

* 2 or more years experience showing proficiency with front-end technologies, including HTML5, CSS3, JavaScript, and jQuery
* Experience building websites / microsites without relying on external frameworks is a huge plus, as you will be writing your own CSS / JS / HTML from scratch
* Familiarity with Ajax and asynchronous / dynamic content
* Experience creating complex mobile-first, responsive websites / microsites
* Solid understanding of cross browser/device responsive development
* Background in design / having a good eye for design, ability to pick up where mockups leave off
* Ability to manipulate the DOM while working within the confines of a CMS (Squarespace, Shopify, Weebly, etc)
* Experience utilizing Bootstrap framework
* Experience theming content within an existing platform; able to build a theme from the ground up, able to skin or build out a simple plugin, able to use a code editor to build complex JS/jQuery that will work within the platform, able to create readable and concise CSS
* Good understanding of ADA/WCAG compliance for an accessible web
* Experience debugging in the browser
* Understanding semantic structure and best JS / CSS practices to maintain optimization (understanding of caching/minification, image optimization, etc.)
* Strong communication / interpersonal skills, able to form productive working relationships while working remotely
* Ability to manage time and expectations while juggling multiple projects with different teams
* Excels under pressure and working with hard deadlines

**Job Type:** Temporary

*Salary based on skills and experience*

**Salary range:** $$20-$35 per hour

*Gramercy Consultants, LLC is committed to providing equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants without regard to race, religion or religious creed, color, sex (including pregnancy, childbirth, or related medical condition), genetic information, gender, gender identity and gender expression, sexual orientation, national origin, ancestry, citizenship status, marital status, uniform service member status, military and veteran status, tribal status, age, physical or mental disability, or any other protected status in accordance with applicable federal, state, and local laws.*

Schedule:

* Monday to Friday
* On call

title: Sr. AWS Back-End Software Developer (Node.js)
description:
**Company Overview:**  

At Tactacam, we are a rapidly growing and market-leading outdoor products and technology company. With over 500,000+ active customers worldwide and an expanding product line, we offer exciting opportunities for career growth and personal development. Join us at Tactacam, where innovation, adventure, and limitless possibilities await!

 **Job Overview:**  

A top candidate will be a team-player individual, highly knowledgeable in his or her field, innovative, communicative, solution-driven, and a team player. We work in a fast-paced environment where team members are client-focused to expedite the iterative process. All candidates must be comfortable communicating directly to internal and external senior leadership regularly. Our culture is collaborative, creative, and professional. Team members have conviction and are  

tenacious and once a decision is determined, they commit wholly and align with team delivery patterns and processes.

 **On this team you will:**  

Work closely with developers as your core customers aligning with organization and product initiative delivery across Tactacam product streams.  

Align with design and implementation of AWS architecture and services, identify, and investigate new technologies, prototype solutions, and test and review changes, to deliver an exceptional customer experience.  

Use core AWS technologies and services to design and build scalable back-end services and customer-facing APIs.  

Collaborate and work alongside a passionate group of software engineers and product teams.

 **The Ideal Candidate:**  

Will use your technical skills to drive towards the right product aligned solutions and implementations.  

Has experience designing large-scale systems and is familiar with horizontal scaling, high throughput and massive, rapidly growing data sets.  

Enjoys solving complex software problems, and possesses design and problem-solving skills.  

Has an in-depth understanding in SDLC areas like IDE’s, source code management, CI/CD and compliance solutions.  

Is knowledgeable in distributed systems, event-driven architectures, and NoSQL databases.  

Collaborating with cross-functional teams to design, build, and implement large-scale AWS solutions.  

Has an in-depth understanding in SDLC areas like work level agreements, source code management, CI/CD, and compliance solutions.

**Responsibilities:**  

Support the strategic decisions about technology, definition, implementation and releasable deliverables for projects and initiatives.  

Enhancing the mobile experience provided to our customers through innovative features.  

Work closely with stakeholders to fix bugs and implement new features.  

Collaborating and coordinating with all facets of the SDLC including solution planning, architecture, software development, delivery, and execution.  

Understanding of agile software development and how that impacts the operations of software; and participate in strategy discussion with all levels.

**Requirements:**


Experience with multiple AWS services including SQS, Lambda, DynamoDB, CloudFormation, S3, OpenSearch, API Gateway, etc.  

Monitoring, Metrics and Auditing, AWS CloudWatch (Metrics, Logs, Alarms, Synthetics), Event Bridge, CloudTrail, SNS.  

Experience working in an Agile/Scrum setting, including partnering with product owners, business analysts, cross-functional developer teams and testers, and implementing solutions following work level agreements and product delivery frameworks.  

Experience integrating with third-party APIs and Web Services, and API Gateways.  

Experience designing large-scale systems and is familiar with horizontal scaling, high throughput, and massive rapidly growing data sets.  

5+ years of experience contributing to the system design or architecture (architecture, design patterns, reliability, and scaling) of new and current systems.  

Experience with code management tools like Git, GitHub, and alignment with team code management work level agreements.  

5+ years of experience deploying and managing AWS applications.  

Experience with Node, JavaScript, TypeScript, Linters, Jest, Unit Testing, Integration Testing, and developing REST API and integrations.

**Location Limitations:**


Please note at this time, we are not accepting applications from candidates based in Alaska (AK), California (CA), Connecticut (CT), Delaware (DE), Hawaii (HI), Massachusetts (MA), Montana (MT), New Mexico (NM), New York (NY), Oregon (OR), Vermont (VT), Washington (WA), Washington, D.C. (DC), Illinois (IL), or Wyoming (WY). We encourage candidates from other locations to apply for our open positions.

title: Back End Developer
description:
Do you want to **LOVE** where you work?


Jacoby & Meyers is the pre-eminent law firm protecting consumers since 1972. We are currently seeking a smart and capable Back End Developer to join our growing team. At Jacoby and Meyers, every single employee gets to make an impact. Our values guide the way we work with each other. It's a culture where you have the freedom to experiment and push your talents as far as they can go.

**Job Title:** Back End Developer  

**Pay Range:** $90K- 140K Plus Bonus  

**Type of Position:** Full Time  

**Location:** Fully Remote

**Job Description:**


Core duties and responsibilities include the following. Other duties may be assigned.

* Provide application, server, database, and development support and services.
* Work in a Windows-based environment as well as utilize Microsoft Office Suite.
* Update existing tools and develop new services to address changing team needs
* Update settings in automation tools
* Manage database fields and users
* XML and JSON coding
* MS SQL database administration

**Requirements:**

* 3+ years of experience providing systems integration and/or back-end development
* A love for solving puzzles and finding solutions
* Very well organized
* Ability to work with users with widely varying technical skills
* Quick response to requests during business hours
* Ability to prioritize requests when necessary
* Strong verbal and written communication skills

**What We Offer:**

* Medical, Dental, Vision, and Pet Insurance
* Company-paid Life Insurance and AD&D Coverage, Voluntary Life Insurance
* Short-term and Long-term Disability
* Employee Assistance and Travel Assistance Programs
* Paid Time Off, Paid Sick Time, Paid Holidays
* Health FSA and Dependent Care FSA
* Hospital and Accident Insurance Plans
* Commuter Transportation Incentive
* Flexible Hours
* Fully-paid parking
* 401(k) with Company Match
* Learning and Development Programs
* Remote Positions

**About J&M:**


Jacoby & Meyers was founded in 1972 with the intention of making the legal system more accessible to the average person. Now, more than 50 years later, we continue to help people get the justice and compensation they deserve. Specializing in all types of accident claims, including automobile, motorcycle, bicycle, Uber/Lyft, or trucking accidents, slip and falls, dog bites, construction accidents and other wrongful conduct, the attorneys at Jacoby & Meyers have recovered over a billion dollars for their clients' personal injury and wrongful death claims caused by the negligence of a third party.

description:

title: Back-end Developer
description:
Be the first to apply to the next job.

This job already got lots of applicants. Coach Pro gives you real-time alerts so you are the first to apply to the job you want.



Get Coach Pro
Somos una corporación multinacional de bebidas y alimentos fundada en 1885 con operaciones en más 14 países, con más de 15,000 colaboradores. Tenemos el portafolio de bebidas más grande de la región, y contamos con socios estratégicos como PepsiCo y AB InBev. El último año hemos tenido una expansión a nivel global que nos ha llevado a dividirnos en 4 unidades de negocio: apex (transformación), cbc (distribución), beliv (innovación en bebidas) y bia (alimentos); y como parte de nuestra estrategia dinámica de expansión y crecimiento requerimos talentos para unirse a nuestra corporación.
### **Funciones del cargo**


Responsable de que el sistema funcione detrás de escena. Su rol es integrar la aplicación con todos los sistemas y servicios requeridos y proporcionar API limpias y fáciles de usar para la parte frontal del sistema. Aunque su trabajo suele estar oculto para el usuario, es responsabilidad total de la funcionalidad, el rendimiento y la capacidad de ampliación de la aplicación. Ellos saben cómo escribir APIs modernos limpios, integrarse con sistemas heredados y trabajar con bases de datos.* Diseñar y desarrollar la lógica de negocios y los sistemas backend del producto
* Trabajar de cerca con desarrolladores frontend para diseñar y desarrollar APIs funcionales, completos y de desempeño
* Descifrar los sistemas de software de las compañías existentes y ser capaz de conectar la aplicación a las fuentes de datos aplicables
* Escribir tanto pruebas de unidad como de integración, y desarrollar herramientas de automatización para tareas diarias
* Desarrollar código de alta calidad, bien documentado y eficiente
* Retar ideas y opiniones para evitar errores y soluciones ineficientes
* Manejo de tiendas SQL y NoSQL (ej. MySQL, Oracle, MongoDB, Couchbase, etc.)
* Integrar frameworks JavaScript, como React, Angular JS
* Manejo de infraestructura inmutable, automatización de infraestructura y herramientas de aprovisionamiento
### **Requerimientos del cargo**


* 3 años de experiencia como Backend Developer
* Experiencia con lenguajes y frameworks comunes (Java Spring Boot, NodeJS, etc.), programación funcional en Scala
* Tener un manejo de programación orientada a objetos y principios de ingeniería como SOLID
* Experiencia implementando la escritura y utilización de servicios autónomos orientados a RESTful API y aplicaciones de ajuste de desempeño a gran escala
* Manejo de consola nivel avanzado}
* Conocimiento de la herramienta Jira - Confluence (como usuario)
* Herramientas de base datos - código – terraform (usuario avanzado)
* Java 19/20
* Golang
### **Conditions**


**Flexible hours** Flexible schedule and freedom for attending family needs or personal errands.
**Computer provided** Global Mobility Apex, S.A. provides a computer for your work.
**Informal dress code** No dress code is enforced.
**Remote work policy**
----------------------



**Locally remote only**


Position is 100% remote, but candidates must reside in South America.

title: Front End and Mobile Developer - Flutter
description:
**ABOUT US**

SafetyIQ is a leading global provider in safety SaaS solutions. Our mission is to deliver transformational software that empowers organisations to champion a world where every person is safe at work. We do this through providing safety software that supports both preventative and predictive health and safety management solutions that include mobile, lone and remote worker management, proactive fatigue and risk management and EHS management.

**ABOUT THE ROLE**

We are seeking a talented Front End Flutter Developer who will be responsible for developing market-leading web and mobile solutions. In this role you will be responsible for collaborating with cross-functional teams and delivering high-quality, innovative digital products. This is your chance to contribute to a product that truly helps keep people safe. The ideal candidate will have extensive experience in the following front-end and mobile technologies with a proven track record of implementing innovative software solutions to solve complex problems.

Key responsibilities:

* Design, develop and maintain the front-end development lifecycle from concept and design to testing, deployment and maintenance across Android, iOS and Web platforms, ensuring high performance and seamless user experience that adds real customer value - utilizing a technology stack grounded in Flutter, Firebase and Azure cloud services.
* Apply a strong understanding of OO and MVVM design principles and patterns to contribute to the development of robust and scalable mobile applications.
* Deliver effective and automated product deployment through CI/CD pipelines, ensuring stable execution and deployment of the resulting web and app features, including Google Play and Apple App Store approval and deployment.
* Optimize application performance for maximum speed and scalability while ensuring application responsiveness across various devices and platforms and adherence to best practice security practices.
* API integration including front end components with back-end and third-party RESTful API’s.
* Conduct unit and regression testing, both manual and automated to ensure code is of a high quality.
* Performance of key agile duties including assistance with backlog and sprint management, estimates, troubleshooting and problem-solving – ensuring features are designed and built to specification without bottlenecks.
* Troubleshoot and resolve technical issues including the review and interpretation of logs, crash analytics and monitoring data, consolidating information into actionable items, defects and tracking.
* Collaborate effectively with a passionate and dedicated team, providing guidance and support to foster team growth, development and high standards of quality.
* Stay up to date with the latest industry trends and practices in Flutter, front-end technologies and Azure services to continuously improve development processes and offerings.
* **We are happy to also consider this role as a Senior Full Stack Senior Developer, with demonstrated commercial experience working with C#/.Net highly regarded.**

**ABOUT YOU**

* Minimum of 5+ years of front-end development, with proficiency in Flutter/Dart.
* Minimum of 3+ years hybrid or mobile native development experience, with a proven record of delivering mobile apps solutions to market including signing /packaging apps for Google Play/AppStore/TestFlight.
* Proficient in the Dart programming language and deep understanding of the Flutter framework and its core principles including a strong understanding of User Interface design principles and patterns. Experience using Stacked Services highly regarded.
* Demonstrated experience integrating RESTful/other standardized APIs.
* Demonstrated experience using deployment platforms such as Code Magic and experience with Azure cloud services.
* Proficiency with testing frameworks and writing automated tests.
* A genuine Team Player with the ability to work in an agile development/scrum environment, collaborating closely with cross-functional teams to deliver high-quality software solutions.
* Strong analytical problem-solving skills and the ability to think critically to identify and resolve technical challenges.
* Excellent written and verbal communication skills
* Experience with communication and collaboration tools that include Git, Confluence, JIRA, Teams and Figma, along with an ability to effectively document and convey technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders.
* Demonstrated strong organisational skills, with the ability to respond to changing priorities and manage competing deadlines, with a high attention to detail and commitment to accuracy.
* Strong experience with C#/.Net will be very highly regarded.
* Exemplify the SafetyIQ values of Caring for Customers, Performing with Purpose, Championing Innovation, Winning Together and Acting with Integrity.
* Experience with safety solutions and processes will be very highly regarded.

**WHAT WE ARE OFFERING**

At SafetyIQ we enjoy a vibrant workplace where high performance meets innovation, and the customer is at the heart of everything we do. We celebrate success, foster continuous learning and work as one team. At SafetyIQ every voice matters and your contributions have a direct impact. As a member of our team, you will enjoy the following benefits:

* A competitive base salary
* Comprehensive health, dental, and vision insurance (70%/30% employer/employee contribution)
* 401(k) plan with company matching up to 3%
* Competitive vacation, paid time off, floating holiday and parental leave policies
* Continuous training and career development opportunities
* Newly fitted-out offices, with office perks such as stocked drinks and snacks
* A supportive and friendly work environment with regular team events and celebrations

SafetyIQ is an Equal Opportunity Employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees.

Job Type: Full-time

Salary: Up to $135,000.00 per year

Benefits:

* 401(k) matching
* Dental insurance
* Employee assistance program
* Health insurance
* Paid time off
* Parental leave
* Professional development assistance
* Vision insurance

Compensation package:

* Yearly pay

Experience level:

* 5 years

Schedule:

* Monday to Friday

* Please provide a link to your pub.dev contributions and/or Github profile in your CV

Experience:

* Mobile applications: 3 years (Required)
* Commercial Flutter: 3 years (Required)

title: WordPress Website Designer
description:
This position is an **individual contract position in the United States**. International Candidates and 3rd-party firms need not apply.  

  

Tree Ring Digital, a Denver based, top-rated digital marketing agency, is seeking a talented self-motivated, proactive WordPress Website Designer to contribute to our growing and collaborative team. Our WordPress Website Designer will work with the development and project management team to design custom WordPress websites.  

**About Us:** Our culture is unique and pretty hard to beat: we’re like-minded people who share common passions, appreciate one another’s unique ideas, enjoy each other’s company, respect each other’s skills, have each other’s backs, and love what we do. We’re a well-established, diligent, and creative group that thrives in our fast-paced work environment. Our firm is committed to a work/life balance for all team members.  

**About our dream candidate:** This individual should have experience designing and editing a variety of unique websites including small business, eCommerce, blog, and membership portals. They will work with content writers and WordPress developers to ensure we are providing our clients with engaging, results-driven websites. They will also assist the marketing team in building attractive landing pages for marketing campaigns.  

**Essential Functions/Responsibilities (including, but not limited to):*** **Performing:**
	+ Wireframe Designs.
	+ Website Design & Building of Site in WordPress.
	+ Website edits (ie: content changes, editing contact forms, creating new pages, updating menu items, etc.)
	+ Work in a timely manner.
* **Providing Support in:**
	+ Troubleshooting WordPress, website, and plugin issues.
	+ Responsive design and mobile-related issues.
	+ Troubleshooting and resolving site-related issues quickly and efficiently.
	+ Quality check before work goes to the client for review.
	+ Installing plugins, tracking codes, and CSS classes for the marketing team.

  

**Job Requirements, Skills, Abilities and Education:*** Adheres to project hours requirements, timelines, and tracking time appropriately.
* Ability to proactively identify client growth opportunities and communicate efficiently with the business development team.
* Using the data provided by our discovery team and performing competitor research to build and design engaging WordPress websites that encourage users to stay on the site and take action.
* Designing websites for diverse organizations ranging from small to midsize businesses and including blogs, eCommerce sites, online learning, and membership portals.
* Working with the project manager and design team to complete projects in a timely manner.
* A mix of 65% front-end and 35% back-end.
* Highly motivated to complete projects by deadlines.
* Excellent verbal and written communications skills (phone, email, and face-to-face)
* Excellent computer skills with proficiency in Microsoft Word, Excel, Google Drive, and Dropbox.
* Strong organizational, prioritization, troubleshooting, and decision-making skills.
* High level of:
	+ Attention to detail (including accurate data entry skills)
	+ Self-motivation.
	+ Knowledge of WordPress builders, plugins, and maintenance.
* Ability to:
	+ Think several steps ahead and execute tasks without (or before) being given direction (once trained)
	+ Think through all possible solutions and determine the best solution.
	+ Take work direction well & follow specific processes and procedures (once taught)
	+ Work well independently, as well as in a collaborative environment.
	+ Utilize the correct tools, resources, and team members to find answers to client questions.

  

**Our Ideal Candidate Will Have/Be:*** 2-3 years experience in WordPress design required.
* 2-3 years managing multiple websites simultaneously required.
* Proficient in:
	+ WordPress core.
	+ WordPress plugins and 3rd-party integrations.
	+ Responsive website design.
	+ HTML5 and CSS3.
	+ PHP, MySQL, and JavaScript (Minimum of Entry-level WordPress Knowledge)
	+ FTP.
	+ Site and image optimization techniques.
	+ Cross-Browser Compatibility and Mobile-First Responsive Design.
	+ Photoshop.
	+ Inspect tool preferred.
	+ XD preferred.
* Basic knowledge/experience with:
	+ Editing/understanding of WordPress websites.
	+ Installing WordPress.
	+ Installing development sites and staging environments.
	+ Making development sites live.
	+ Page builder tools (WPBakery, Elementor, Divi, etc)
	+ WordPress back-end development (including custom post types, theme customization, plug-in configuration and customization, and database structure)
	+ eCommerce systems which include WooCommerce setup (including variable products, shipping, and payment gateway configurations)
	+ Various plugins including Gravity Forms, ACF, LearnDash, and MemberPress.
	+ GSuite, Office 365, Slack, QuickBooks, WordPress, 1Password & Dropbox.

  

**What We Offer the Right Candidate:**
This position is a contract position with an hourly wage of $35-50/hour DOE and will be between 15-30 hours per week depending on skillset. The contractor will have the ability to work from home. Client communication can be handled on Zoom or a phone call.  


Our standard hours are Monday - Friday from 9 am - 5:30 pm MST so conference calls with clients will need to be handled within these hours. Work can be completed at any time as long as deadlines are met.  


Tree Ring Digital is committed to creating a diverse environment and is proud to be an equal-opportunity employer.  

Come join a team with a clear mandate to deliver high value to clients.  


We appreciate your excitement, but please no calls to our office. Only applications received through this portal will be considered.

We seek a creative WordPress Developer to design and implement attractive and functional websites. You will be responsible for both back-end and front-end development, including implementing WordPress themes and plugins and site integration and security updates.  

  

DLZP Group is an innovative and growing minority and woman-owned tech company committed to serving our clients through innovative, cost-effective, agile, and secure IT solutions. We strive to create a positive, open environment for our team and clients.  

  

**Responsibilities**  

* Collaboration with team members and clients to discuss website design and function.
* Designing and building the website front-end.
* Creating the website architecture.
* Designing and managing the website back-end, including database and server integration.
* Generating WordPress themes and plugins.
* Conducting website performance tests.
* Troubleshooting content issues.

  

**Qualifications**  

* Proven work experience as a WordPress Developer.
* Knowledge of front-end technologies, including CSS, JavaScript, HTML, MySQL, PHP, and jQuery.
* Familiarity with version control systems, preferably Git.
* Experience working with debugging tools such as Chrom Inspector and Firebug.
* Ability to manage projects.
* Good communication skills.
* Ability to work independently and as part of a team.

  

  

Must be a U.S. Citizen and U.S.-based.  

Equal Opportunity Employer  

This is a remote position.

title: Business Development & eCommerce Associate
description:
**Business Development & eCommerce Associate**

 **Status:** Permanent, Full-Time, Salaried

**Location:** Remote (Accepting applicants located and eligible to work in either the USA or Canada).

 **About Beauty Industry Group**  

  

*Hidden Crown is a proud subsidiary of Beauty Industry Group, a beauty company that owns a portfolio of beauty brands based in North America, Australia, and parts of Europe and Latin America.*  

  

Founded in 2004, over the past 18 years BIG has evolved into a high-growth family of premier brands sold in more than 1,200 stores throughout North America, and with its collective brands servicing more than 100,000 hair salons and stylists, and millions of consumers across 165+ countries worldwide. BIG has grown exponentially to become the leading platform in the rapidly growing, global hair extensions category, and has become a trusted hair extension solution for both stylists and consumers. Through its multi-brand and multi-channel approach, BIG has established itself across direct-to-stylist (DTS), direct-to-consumer (DTC), and professional distribution channels. The company continues to drive innovation across the market with a strong appetite for additional brand and product expansion.


BIG is a unique, empowering place to work for motivated professionals who are driven to see the


impact their work is making. The management team, led by CEO Derrick Porter, has fostered a powerful culture that celebrates excellence, transparency, diversity, and integrity.

 *The company headquarters are located in Salt Lake City, Utah, with additional offices in California, New Jersey, Arizona, Australia, Germany, Canada, and the UK.*

**Job Description**  

  

As the Hidden Crown Business Development & eCommerce Associate, you will play a pivotal role supporting core day-to-day tasks in the business development & ecommerce scope. Reporting to the Brand Manager, Hidden Crown, and working closely with our operational & warehouse teams based in SLC, you will oversee a portfolio which supports operations, fulfillment, product lifecycle management and backend e-commerce needs.  

  

Effective collaboration is key within this role as our Business Development & eCommerce Associate will work closely with Finance, Marketing, Product and other data owners across the organization to ensure alignment across teams and influence operational initiatives to support achievement of business targets.

  

If you’re passionate about the beauty industry, care about working for a values driven company, and want to deliver true growth and innovation through your work, then Hidden Crown is the place for you. Today, our team consists of remote employees across Canada and the USA, working to truly provide the most innovative products and the best in class customer experience. We are committed to a growth focused, people first culture, and are constantly striving for improvement in our processes each and every day. The key responsibilities of this role can be found below:

**Responsibilities & Duties**  

  

*Business Development & Operations*

* Liaise with SLC warehouse operations, and lead inventory management and day to day operations (i.e. management of OOS, update of OOS items, potentially help to manage backorders by adding tags and dates in Shopify (if implemented at Hidden Crown (in the works) as well as initiatives within Special Projects
* Manage the fulfillment process beginning to end (working with Supply Chain on bi-weekly replenishment meetings, forecasting, supply & demand planning).
* Manage all Master SKU Documentation for the brand (SKU, description, SRP, COGS etc) and keep this regularly updated with any new additions to allow for consistent margin analysis / pricing analysis.
* Work with key stakeholders to identify process improvement opportunities, develop and quantify improvement recommendations, implement process improvements, and work in a culture of continuous improvement.
* Support product Lifecycle Management: Monitoring product performance, gathering customer and brand feedback, and identifying opportunities for updates. *This would be in tandem with our Product Development Team.*

*eCommerce & Other Project Support*

* Quick management of back-end website needs, and day to day web troubleshooting.
* Work closely with our web developer team for site optimization, programming, testing operations for promotions and site updates.
* Real-time updates on e-Commerce backend, including the posting of timely banners and pushing blogs live.
* Pull reports on site performance, how pages are performing, what is being utilized, what is not? Work with an internal center of excellence on website optimization plans based on these findings.
* Support leadership in implementing projects from end-to-end (I.e. pricing analysis, loyalty programs, technological innovations, external reach outs etc.)
* Support with all other ad hoc duties and responsibilities as assigned.

**Requirements:**

* A bachelor’s degree is required; a degree in supply chain management, business administration or a related field is preferred.
* 2+ years of experience as an operations coordinator, business development manager, ecommerce coordinator or a similar role in scope, seniority & responsibility is preferred.
* Professional experience using Microsoft Excel and prior experience working with supply planning systems (i.e., NetSuite, Demand Works, etc.) is strongly preferred.
* Basic understanding of ecommerce platforms, supply chain systems, fulfillment, financial forecasting, and stakeholder management.
* Ability to take ownership in a fast-paced, high-growth environment.
* Meticulous with details and incredibly organized.
* A data-driven mindset and the ability to translate data into actionable insights.
* Experience in the beauty and/or consumer packaged goods industry is a plus.

 **Benefits and Perks:**

* Competitive Salary
* 401(k) with company match - $ for $ up to 4% - immediately vested
* Vacation/Holiday Leave
* Great Medical/Dental/Vision Insurance
* Life and AD&D Insurance
* Access to hundreds of discounted beauty/hair products
* Opportunities for growth and advancement
* Fully Remote - Work from home
* *And so much more!*

**Candidate Support**

  

If you are contacted for an interview and require accommodation during the interviewing process, please reach out to the People & Culture team regarding support.

*We thank you for considering this opportunity and thank everyone who took the time to apply. Please note that all candidates will be updated on the status of their application up to 6 weeks after the application closing date. We appreciate your patience as we diligently review all applications submitted.*

title: React Developer
description:
T-Rex Solutions is looking to select a skilled and motivated React Developer to support the US Department of the Treasury TCloud enterprise cloud development effort. This effort aims to facilitate holistic multi-cloud solutions to meet the Department of Treasury's enterprise-wide infrastructure needs. As a React Developer, you will be responsible for designing, developing, and maintaining user interfaces using the React framework. You will collaborate with cross-functional teams to create innovative and visually appealing web applications that deliver exceptional user experiences. The ideal candidate should have a strong understanding of front-end development principles, excellent problem-solving skills, and a passion for creating cutting-edge web applications.


**Responsibilities:**


* Develop high-quality, responsive, and scalable user interfaces using React.js.
* Collaborate with product managers, designers, and back-end developers to understand project requirements and translate them into technical specifications.
* Write clean, efficient, and maintainable code using best practices and industry standards.
* Optimize web applications for maximum speed and scalability.
* Conduct thorough testing and debugging to ensure the highest level of quality and performance.
* Stay up-to-date with the latest trends and advancements in front-end development, and share knowledge with the team.
* Participate in code reviews to maintain code quality and ensure adherence to coding standards.
* Troubleshoot and resolve front-end issues and bugs.
* Collaborate with the back-end development team to integrate front-end and back-end functionalities.
* Continuously improve development processes and workflows.


**Requirements:**


* Bachelor's Degree and 10+ years of professional experience
* Proven experience as a React Developer or similar role, with a strong portfolio of projects.
* Proficiency in JavaScript, HTML, CSS, and related front-end technologies.
* Solid understanding of React.js and its core principles.
* Experience with popular React workflows (such as Redux, Context API, or Hooks).
* Familiarity with RESTful APIs and integrating front-end applications with back-end services.
* Knowledge of modern front-end build tools and package managers (e.g., Webpack, Babel, npm).
* Familiarity with version control systems (e.g., Git) and code branching strategies.
* Strong problem-solving skills and attention to detail.
* Excellent communication and collaboration abilities.
* Ability to work effectively in a fast-paced, agile development environment.
* US Citizenship required


**Desired:**


* Active Treasury clearance
* Experience with testing frameworks (e.g., Jest, Enzyme) and test-driven development.
* Knowledge of UI/UX design principles and ability to collaborate with designers.
* Familiarity with server-side rendering (SSR) and Next.js.
* Understanding of progressive web application (PWA) development.
* Knowledge of responsive design and mobile development.
* Experience with other front-end frameworks (e.g., Angular, Vue.js) is a plus.


**T-Rex Overview**



Established in 1999, T-Rex Solutions, LLC is a proven mid-tier business providing data-centric mission services to the Federal government as it increasingly tries to secure and leverage the power of data. We design, integrate, secure, and deploy advanced technical solutions for our customers so they can efficiently fulfill their critical objectives. T-Rex offers both IT and professional services to numerous Federal agencies and is a leader in providing high quality and innovative solutions in the areas of Cloud and Infrastructure Services, Cyber Security, and Big Data Engineering.



T-Rex is constantly seeking qualified people to join our growing team. We have built a broad client base through our devotion to delivering quality products and customer service, and to do that we need quality individuals. But more than that, we at T-Rex are committed to creating a culture that supports the development of every employee's personal and professional lives. T-Rex has made a commitment to maintain the status of an industry leader in compensation packages and benefits which includes competitive salaries, performance bonuses, training and educational reimbursement, Transamerica 401(k) and Cigna healthcare benefits.



T-Rex is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, religion, color, sex (including pregnancy, gender identity, and sexual orientation), parental status, national origin, age, disability, family medical history or genetic information, political affiliation, military service, or other non-merit based factors.



As part of our overall strategy and commitment to maintaining a safe and healthy workplace, and in accordance with applicable regulations, employees of T-Rex must be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 if required by customer or client policies or federal mandates as a condition of employment, subject to reasonable accommodation and other requirements under applicable federal, state, and local law. If required by the customer, the selected individual will have to submit documentation of proof of vaccination before starting employment with T-Rex or have an approved exemption prior to the start of employment.



In compliance with pay transparency guidelines, the annual base salary range for this position is $75,000 - $150,000. Please note that the salary information is a general guideline only. T-Rex considers factors such as (but not limited to) scope and responsibilities of the position, candidate's work experience, education/training, key skills, internal peer equity, as well as market and business considerations when extending an offer.

title: Front End Engineer
description:
Amida Technology Solutions is a DC-based technology company focused on solutions for data interoperability, data utility, and data security. We create open-source solutions that collect, reconcile, transform, and standardize data for business intelligence, predictive analytics, decision support, and user transactions. We specialize in taking data from inception to impact.

Our team is comprised of creative, forward thinkers who are passionate about using cutting-edge technology to make a difference in people's lives and have a positive impact on our country. We offer an entrepreneurial, high-growth environment that values fresh ideas, candid conversations, and authentic teamwork.

Amida is seeking an experienced **Front-End Engineer** to join our team in **Washington DC** or a **remote location**, to our growing development team for Microelectronics Security software solutions. You will actively contribute to front-end initiatives for our cutting-edge software technology. You will develop on a state-of-the-art UI/UX that seamlessly integrates with Amida's cutting-edge analysis engine and delivers innovative visualization capabilities supporting Amida's technology roadmap.

**What You Will Do:**

* Collaborate with back-end developers and UI/UX designers to develop a best-in-class visualization engine for Amida's Microelectronics Security solution
* Design and engineer a robust and highly responsive front-end architecture to facilitate clear and engaging visualizations of analysis outcomes, providing a seamless UI/UX that empowers engineers to effectively interpret and evaluate security analysis data
* Interface with internal and external stakeholders to identify key features and requirements for future project releases
* Translate UI/UX designs into high-quality code that is easy to maintain and test
* Troubleshoot interface software and debug application codes
* Monitor and improve front-end performance
* Document application updates and facilitate user training on the application

**Required Skills:**

* Bachelor's Degree, certification, or equivalent work experience in software development
* 5+ years of experience working on front end development using JavaScript frameworks such as react
* 5+ years of experience producing HTML, CSS, and JavaScript web application interfaces
* 2+ years of experience in utilizing Electron for desktop applications
* Strong communication skills, attention to detail, and demonstrated ability to deliver best-in-class software products
* Ability to obtain a Public Trust security clearance

**Preferred Skills:**

* Familiarity with Graph Theory and visualizations using tools such as Neo4J
* Experience using the D3 JavaScript library to create interactive data visualizations
* Familiarity with standard EDA products for RTL simulation and emulation

Communication is the key to success at Amida. Our people are known for their can-do attitude and their ability to work effectively with client teams. We pride ourselves on having a collegial, multidisciplinary team with diverse backgrounds and experience. Our best team members pay intense attention to detail in all aspects of their work, have a strong sense of initiative, and are willing to be opinionated about the best ways of doing things. A sense of humor is an asset at Amida.

We help solve the biggest challenges in data management. If you're looking for an opportunity to help important organizations get their data right, we hope you'll forward your resume and let us know why this role appeals to you. We look forward to hearing from you.

Amida Technology Solutions is an equal opportunity employer, and all qualified applicants will receive consideration without regard to race, color, religion, gender, national origin, disability status, protected Veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law. We value diversity of ideas and people.

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: From $130,000.00 per year

Benefits:

* 401(k)
* 401(k) matching
* Dental insurance
* Health insurance
* Paid time off
* Vision insurance

Schedule:

* 8 hour shift
* Monday to Friday

Education:

* Bachelor's (Required)

Experience:

* Electron: 2 years (Required)
* JavaScript: 5 years (Required)
* React: 5 years (Required)
* Neo4j: 1 year (Preferred)

Work Location: Remote

title: Senior Software Developer - Back-end / Cloud
description:
This position is for an experienced software developer to take a leading role in the back-end development, refactoring, scaling, and feature enhancement of the Aquana cloud platform.

  



You'll help drive our back-end services and real-time data processing pipelines, including scaling sensor data throughput, enhancing rule-based systems, integrating machine learning inputs, and supporting 3rd-party integrations with a variety of players. In addition, your experience will help guide future technology directions as we grow our customer base and capabilities.

 **Major Responsibilities include:**

  

* Take a lead role in application back-end development, including business logic, web services, private apis, feature additions, performance optimization, code development, and high-availability/high-scalability architectures
* Help provide a world-class IoT platform for a varied array of sensor device data and data analytic workflows
* Assist in administering and monitoring of AWS cloud hosted computing environments, including Relational databases, No-sql data, messaging queues, and scalable configuration-based environment architectures.
* Working closely with management, other development team members, customers, and hardware engineering groups to understand and develop features and solve scalability and business issues.
* Perform other responsibilities as needed.


Required skills and experience with:

* Extensive Visual Studio / C# / .net core development experience
* API design and development
* Scalable / microservices / separation of concerns software development concepts
* Database and management - AWS Aurora/MySql, No-sql data stores, data lakes, performance
* A good sense of operational architecture design for SaaS applications
* Amazon AWS experience
* GitHub code repository
* A desire to learn and lead new technologies and cutting edge scalable IoT architectures

  

Desired working knowledge or familiarity with:

* Integration with 3rd party Api services, and working with customer platforms
* MQTT and message brokering
* Graphing libraries, and time-series data analytics
* Security concepts for dev and server operations
* Remote shells / scripting for ad-hoc tooling needs
* RF/Async concepts including: Lorawan low energy radio communications, 3rd party Lorawan Network Server integration, Cellular LTE for IoT / LTE-M services

  

Other strengths:

* Experience with a fast-paced, high-tech, mission critical operation
* Experience developing with principles of software lifecycle management
* Jira ticket tracking, Google docs, and other similar productivity applications
* Good Communication skills - ability to understand work documents, write effectively, and communicate information clearly to coworkers in English
* Protecting data, software, and hardware by coordinating, planning, and following network security measures

  



This position reports directly to the CTO of Aquana. Aquana provides a comprehensive benefits package including vacation, medical, dental, and other insurance, and a company-matched 401(k) retirement plan. Aquana, a subsidiary of the Geospace Corporation, is an equal opportunity employer.

title: Full Stack Mobile Developer
description:

title: Front End Developer (non-US/Eastern Time) C#/Azure/Tailwind/CSS
description:
**Role Level**: IC3 or IC4, **Reports to**: Director of Product, **Salary**: ($113,490 or $139,680) x COL

  

We are seeking a **Front-End Developer** to join our growing Product Development team. The Front-End Developer will work with the User Experience (UX) Architect and Product Owners to make highly-visible and highly-usable contributions to both legacy and greenfield applications. This role is critical to continuing to deliver continuous value to small and medium-sized businesses around the globe who count on BEMO every day to help them securely conduct business in today’s connected world.

  

**Please read the job description fully and carefully before applying.**



BEMO is rapidly-growing company and the Product Department is a key factor in this growth. We deliver continuous value to market and delight our users with the quality and usability of our work. We use lean start-up techniques to fail fast together, grow from validated learning, and celebrate our achievements as a team. We bring our own unique experiences and contributions to the fabric of the team and to BEMO as a whole. We work hard, we play hard, and we are obsessed with learning how to get better.



And we are counting on you to help us take the next step.


At BEMO, competencies for the IC4 level are as follows:


* In-depth specialist knowledge and ability to expand and share that knowledge with team members.
* Skilled problem-solver and critical thinker when faced with new or unfamiliar challenges.
* Strong network of connections with senior professionals within and outside of your area of expertise.
* Make well-informed, data-driven decisions and seek input from relevant stakeholders as needed.
* Consider the big picture and potential consequences when making user interface and user experience decisions, adjusting the approach as needed to mitigate risk.
* Understand how BEMO's strategy affects the team's objectives and may be involved in setting cross-departmental goals.
* Proactive in taking ownership and using initiative to positively impact the organization.
* Build strong relationships with team members and colleagues in other departments.
* Influence others at your level and learn to influence more senior stakeholders in decision-making, planning, and timelines.
* Provide actionable feedback to drive improvement.
* Share expertise with less experienced team members to help them accelerate their learning.
* Understand the importance of being a role model, actively seeking feedback from others, and developing the ability to provide clear and actionable feedback to my peers and manager.


**Responsibilities & Primary Goals**



As Front-End Developer at BEMO, you will bring important client-facing products and applications to life. You will work with the User Experience (UX) Architect and Full-Stack Developers to advocate for the technologies you need to deliver world-class user experiences. You will contribute to foundational design systems that underly all our products. You will help to define, deliver, and to deploy efficient, iterative, and scalable product releases sprint-over-sprint that delight users. You will be a strong advocate for agile and lean start-up working styles because you understand why working this way would be so important to a company of our size. You have a passion for learning and will always advocate for the experience of the end-user.

  

* Design, code, test, and deliver BEMO products and applications (Azure, .NET, C#) with specific emphasis on front-end and user experience. Execute the established scrum-based product development lifecycle to deliver continuous, measurable value to market.
* Help to refine departmental front-end coding, testing, security, and code review standards.
* Keep pace with the competition and thought-leaders in the user experience space to deliver the most-usable security and compliance systems in the world
* Exhibit strong competency in core professional skills, especially attention to detail, responsiveness, follow-through, and flexibility with a high degree of emotional intelligence and tact.
* Conduct yourself in accordance with BEMO’s core values (accountability, agility, focus, fun, teamwork, and transparency) at all times.
* Work with the User Experience Architect and Product Owners to define, refine, and decompose new product development efforts into achievable slices that deliver continuous value sprint-over-sprint along an appropriate architectural runway.
* Ensure acceptance criteria for all work are achievable in the beginning and met in the end.
* Participate in structured walk-throughs, security reviews, and technical reviews to ensure front-end coding and design follows secure coding and design principles.
* Actively support and participate in all team agile ceremonies.
* Participate in the creation of and maintain design systems for core product lines
* Consistently seeks to improve technical knowledge in Microsoft technology, security, compliance, and competitors by spending a portion of their time dedicated to research and certifications.
* Self-motivated drive for excellence


Constantly seeks to delight colleagues and customers alike – our ultimate success as a team will be measured by this. Other duties and development responsibilities as our team and company evolves

  

**Requirements**


* BEMO is a global, fully remote company with mainly non-technical stakeholders. As such, excellent written and spoken English communication skills and a strong ability to empathize and engage with others are essential. Without these skills, technical expertise and design experience alone won't be enough to succeed.Demonstrated experience designing and developing front ends for high-profile customer-facing applications in Microsoft cloud environments.
* Contributor to a healthy, efficient, and evolving agile environment (non-denominational sprint-based scrum/kanban in Azure DevOps) and a champion of the business need to deliver continuous user value to market sprint-over-sprint.
* Familiarity with Microsoft cloud technology and applications, including but not limited to Microsoft Azure, Microsoft 365, Microsoft Intune, Microsoft Partner Center, Azure Active Directory, Microsoft Copilot, Microsoft Lighthouse, Microsoft Azure Sentinel, Microsoft Defender, Azure DevOps, etc.
* Experience mentoring Junior and Intermediate developers to help the team, department, and company grow our capabilities.
* Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Graphic Design (or equivalent) with 3-5 years of experience in front-end development, particularly in lean start-up environments.
* A passion for continuous learning and the enthusiasm and capacity to keep pace with modern usability concepts, technologies, and best practices across all verticals
* Strong problem-solving skills with an analytical mindset.
* A collaborative team player willing to support colleagues and capable of sharing responsibilities to meet team goals.


Ability to build and maintain a high level of trust with internal teams and stakeholders.

  

**Specialized Knowledge or Skills Preferred**


* Deep knowledge of and strong opinions on modern UI/UX concepts and front-end technologies Microsoft Azure certifications a plus (MS-900, AZ-900, etc.)
* Experience simplifying complex systems for non-technical users
* User experience certification a plus (Google UX or similar)
* Experience with both backend and front-end development concepts
* Experience working with a UX Architect, Product Owner, and other developers (front and back end) delivering highly usable systems
* Experience delivering high-quality applications using various testing concepts: Unit testing, integration testing, regression testing, automated testing, and test-driven development.


Familiarity with artificial intelligence (AI) and machine learning (ML) concepts and their application in UI/UX contexts

  

**Application Instructions**



If you are ready to take the next step, ensure the following acceptance criteria are met by your application. Submissions that do not meet these acceptance criteria **will not be considered**:


* 1)Include your most recent resume in English
* 2)Must include a cover letter in English:

	+ Cover letter is no more than 5 paragraphs in total
	+ One paragraph of no more than 3 sentences that tells us how your experience and individuality would make BEMO a better place
	+ Another paragraph of no more than 3 sentences that tell us about a large customer-facing product you contributed to of which you are more proud
	+ A final paragraph that includes a link to a YouTube clip from your favorite movie and tell us what you like about it

SALARY Calculation example:


IC3 $113,490x47.7% (Chile COL)= **$54,134.73**



IC4 $139,680 x47.7% (Chile COL)= **$66,627.36**

title: Technical Lead - Back End
description:
**We're currently hiring for remote team members in the following states: DC, DE, GA, IL, MA, MD, NH, NJ, OH, PA, SC, UT, and VA. #BI-Remote**



We're AWeber - a remote-first company that helps small businesses around the world form meaningful connections with their customers and grow their businesses using our marketing communication software. We are fanatical about small businesses and we hope you are too!



As Technical Lead on our Integrations team, you will design, develop, maintain, and operation solutions the power our public facing APIs as well as our integrations with third party solutions. Your mission will be to build efficient and reliable systems, while mentoring others on your team to do the same, that power delightful experiences for our customers.



Every day you will work alongside a team of skilled engineers, writing APIs and event-driven, distributed microservices in Python with frameworks like Tornado and Rejected. You will leverage internal tools to deploy applications onto a modern, hybrid platform using Docker and Kubernetes. On any given day, you could be found designing/implementing edge facing services to add new subscribers (requiring zero downtime), or evolving our technical solutions for retrieving analytics data and search functionalities, or even providing technical leadership around evolving our login and session management flows. Your code will capture metrics with tools like statsd, Graphite, and Grafana that you will use to monitor the health of services. You will join a 24x7 on-call rotation to make sure our product is available for customers around the clock.



To thrive as a Technical Lead, you take pride in producing secure, well-tested and maintainable code that balances the many competing priorities of a modern web platform while delivering for the customer. You enjoying coaching more junior developers through code reviews, paired programming, and providing technical thought leadership. You feel energized when you've worked with a team to deploy a new feature or solve a tough problem. Learning quickly is one of your super-powers, and you enjoy technologies and problems that are new to you, eager to share what you've learned. You assume intense ownership over your areas of responsibility, always advocating for improvement and pushing to keep systems updated to current standards.

  


**About AWeber:**



At AWeber we create marketing/ communication software that empowers small businesses around the world to form strong connections with their customers and grow their businesses. Who are our customers you might ask? They are creators, bloggers, entrepreneurs - people just like you that are passionate about an idea or product they want to share with the world. At AWeber, YOU make an impact on these small businesses each and every day!



As a team, we work remotely across the US, and although we're in separate locations, nothing can keep us apart! We collaborate everyday using a variety of tools such as slack, google meet, and confluence/ JIRA to ensure we're making decisions with our customers' best interests in mind - something that's not possible when you work in a siloe. At AWeber, YOUR voice and YOUR opinion matters, regardless of your role. We expect all AWeber team members will ask tough questions, provide/ receive feedback regularly, and explore their passions on a daily basis. Sound exciting? Take the next step and apply.

  



**AWeber Benefits:**


* 100% Remote - we're not going back to the office and here's why.
* Strong culture that supports flexibility, entrepreneurialism, and collaboration. Think we should be doing something different? Share your feedback! We're looking for you to add your AWesomeness to our culture.
* We have some other pretty cool benefits to make your life easier:
+ 100% Company Paid PPO medical, dental, vision insurance (spousal and domestic partner benefits available).
